Class GraphicalUnit

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--GraphicalUnit
Direct Known Subclasses:
Unit
public class GraphicalUnit
extends java.lang.Object

Class that contains all properties and methods associated with the graphical appearance of a unit.

Method Detail

setLocation

protected void setLocation(int r,
                           int c)
Moves the picture to row R and column C. If R and C is outside the playing field, no move is performed.

paint

                  DrawArea area)
This function only paints this object to the canvas.

Used for debugging purposes only.

getRandomDir

Randomly generates a new direction EAST, WEST, SOUTH, NORTH.

isTouching

protected boolean isTouching(Unit u)
Check if this unit is touching unit U.

isVisible

protected boolean isVisible(Unit u,
                            int range)
Check if this unit can "see" unit U. In other words if the distance between the two units is <= the visibility range.

moveTowards

protected int moveTowards(Unit u,
                          java.util.Vector units,

Move towards unit U.

                           int myID)
Move away from unit U.

attemptMove

protected boolean attemptMove(int direction)
Called by moveTowards and MoveAwayFrom to see if the move is possible, ie if any other unit is in the way.

Evaluate the situation. Used for communication purposes.
